pageTitle: Itinerary for Thursday, May 23, 2019 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Poundmaker Cree Nation, Saskatchewan

11:45 a.m. The Prime Minister will deliver a statement of exoneration for Chief Poundmaker at a community ceremony. Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness Ralph Goodale and Minister of Crown-Indigenous Relations Carolyn Bennett will be in attendance.

Chief Poundmaker Historical Centre
Map coordinates (52.8391270, -108.9623890)

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media should arrive no later than 10:15 a.m. and must register at the Historical Centre building 
  • Please note that event will take place outdoors

Meadow Lake, Saskatchewan

3:50 p.m. The Prime Minister will deliver remarks and participate in a Q&A session at the Federation of Sovereign Indigenous Nations National Annual General Assembly. Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness Ralph Goodale, Minister of Crown-Indigenous Relations Carolyn Bennett, and Minister of Indigenous Services Seamus Oâ€™Regan will be in attendance.

Flying Dust First Nation
8001 Flying Dust Reserve

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media should arrive no later than 3:00 p.m.
